intro: Saccolabium roseum, commonly known as the pink fairy duster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy, pink to red spines that house the small, white flowers. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native gardens.
